page.title: 04TRANSPORT - HAUGHTON AREA
page.content:
____________________________ Many parents are kept busy transporting their offspring to various social events and most young people look forward to their seventeenth birthday when a provisional licence and driving lessons materialise. When they have successfully passed a driving test and obtained a car, they can travel independantly and venture further afield in pursuit of interests.
Public transport is very limited. There is an early morning and evening bus daily, but a daytime bus only runs on Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday from Crewe to Chester via many small villages.
